[https://videotheque.uness.fr/w/uCda8AuNGkkBKJVzCiPjkB View the recorded ppt on imaging of item 197 by the College of Radiologists (CERF)] [[File:Figure 1 ASAS 2009.png|vignette|'''Figure 1. 2009 ASAS classification criteria for axial spondyloarthritis in patients with spinal pain for more than 3 months and an age of onset less than 45 years.''']] [[File:Figure 2 ASAS 2009.png|thumb|'''Figure 2. ASAS classification criteria for peripheral spondyloarthritis.''']]]

question.question: According to the ASAS 2009 classification criteria, which of the following is a key characteristic for diagnosing axial spondyloarthritis?
question.option_a: Spinal pain lasting more than 6 months and starting before the age of 50
question.option_b: Spinal pain lasting more than 3 months and starting before the age of 45
question.option_c: Spinal pain lasting more than 3 months and starting before the age of 30
question.option_d: Spinal pain lasting more than 12 months and starting before the age of 40
